article_text:
WASHINGTON—General Electric Co.'s retail credit-card business agreed to pay $228.5 million to settle federal allegations it violated consumer-protection laws, government officials said Thursday.

The company, whose North American consumer-lending operations are being spun off into a new company called Synchrony Financial, settled allegations by the Justice Department and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau it excluded Spanish-speaking...
